introduction.title: Functional Physical Area Repository
introduction.description: The following is a list of functional physical areas in a bicycle:

steeringAndSuspension.title: Steering and Suspension
steeringAndSuspension.description: system that connects the handlebars to the front wheel

suspension.description: system that absorbs shock and vibrations from the road

drivetrain.title: Drivetrain
drivetrain.description: system that transmits power from the pedals to the wheels

gears.description: system that allows the rider to adjust the difficulty of pedaling

brakingSystem.title: Braking System
brakingSystem.description: system that slows or stops the bicycle

wheels.description: round, rotating components that support the bicycle's weight

tires.description: rubber components that provide traction and cushioning

frames.description: main structural component of the bicycle

forks.description: components that connect the front wheel to the frame

repositoryStructure.description: The functional physical area repository is organized into the following categories:

exampleUseCases.title: Example Use Cases
exampleUseCases.useCase: A bicycle manufacturer wants to create a new model with improved steering and suspension. They can use the repository to identify the relevant components and sub-systems.
A mechanic wants to repair a broken drivetrain component. They can use the repository to locate the specific part and understand its relationship to other components.
